item.title: How to Write a Cover Letter and Not Hate the Process
item.description: A cover letter is often the first time a hiring manager gets the chance to ‚Äúmeet‚Äù you, so don‚Äôt waste it. Always thank people for their time and, while this might be controversial, ‚Äúbest‚Äù is the best way to sign off (besides ‚Äúlove,‚Äù but unfortunately that‚Äôs not appropriate for a job application. Identify the company‚Äôs mission, look at the way it talks about itself, and reference it in your cover letter. = I know how to write for a specific audience(I‚Äôm a fan of hyperlinking in cover letters and resumes. I can offer a unique perspective coming from the legal sphere, for example, I can help Morning Brew never get sued. Here‚Äôs a copy of my cover letter for Morning Brew:‚ÄúMy name is Mattison Merritt and I‚Äôm a writer, comedian, and social media manager currently living in Chicago. = I‚Äôm good at time managementProve that you did your research‚ÄúI want to join the Morning Brew team as a writer to help make business news more accessible and engaging.‚Äù Maybe humor isn‚Äôt the way to go, but adding a little personality to your cover letter can make you stand out. item.title: C-corp vs. Pass-through Taxes: What‚Äôs the Difference?
item.description: For tax purposes, businesses are either pass-through entities or C corporations. You‚Äôre taxed on your entire share of business profits, regardless of whether they sit in your business or personal bank account. If you‚Äôre paying attention, you might have caught that dividends are taxed twice: once at the entity level and again on our personal tax returns. Business profits are passed through to owners, who pay taxes based on individual tax rates. I‚Äôll owe tax on $40,000, and you‚Äôll owe tax on the remaining $60,000. One of them is how you want your business to be taxed. ¬†Multiple business structures are subject to pass-through taxation. Pass-through entities are businesses that pay income taxes solely on their owners‚Äô individual tax returns. In general, solo entrepreneurs and small businesses opt for pass-through taxation since there‚Äôs less paperwork and red tape, while medium and large companies often favor C-corp tax treatment. It‚Äôs called a pass-through because the business doesn‚Äôt pay an entity-level income tax. And, you can change your business structure or tax status as your business‚Äôs needs evolve. On my tax return, I report my $40,000 salary and my share of the dividend, which is $2,000. Let‚Äôs see how that works if our phone case business is a C-corp. What is C-corp taxation? ¬†Notice how our tax liabilities don‚Äôt take into account how much money we moved from business coffers into our personal bank accounts? C-corps report income and pay taxes on Form 1120.

item.title: Bill and Melinda Gates to Divorce After 27 Years
item.description: The two met in 1987 at Microsoft, which Bill cofounded, got married seven years later, and in 2000 launched the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation. Zoom out: While they haven't gone as far as Coinbase or Basecamp, other tech companies have put up guardrails around what employees can or cannot talk about in internal chats. item.description: So, as the friends traveled the country over the last year to watch Chuck run and also perhaps enjoy a few beers, they never expected the horse to end up qualifying for the most elite horse race in the world. After their first two horses didn‚Äôt work out, they found Hot Rod Charlie, the horse that currently has the fourth-best odds to win the Kentucky Derby this Saturday. Baby Chuck via Patrick O'Neill The people‚Äôs horseO‚ÄôNeill said that the Boat Racing crew has received a lot of support from family and friends, but also from people they‚Äôve never met.
